title: IA investigation number IAD2016-0223 Boston Police

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: IA investigation number IAD2016-0223 Boston Police
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting  documents  for  a 2016 Interanal Affairs investigation number IAD2016-0223 regarding Boston Police Officer Lieutenant David C Murphy, badge number 9375.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Annemarie Grant

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Brian Muoio - Signal
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Regarding Officer Brian Muoio #8381, I am requesting from his City-owned Android device:

1. For every conversation in the officer’s Signal app, including archived and deleted conversations, please provide:
1a. The title, avatar, description, and retention period set for the chat.
1b. A listing of all members in the chat.
1c. All messages, images, and files sent and received in the chat, sufficient to discern sender’s name and avatar, time received, and message content, as well as events including but not limited to entering and leaving chat, changing retention time, etc.

2. The list of all contacts in the officer’s Signal app. This can be found by clicking the “New Message” icon.

3. The name, avatar, and username set for the officer themself. This can be found by clicking the profile icon.

If copying these messages by hand is burdensome, I understand that SPD owns software tools that can be used to extract these records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Erica Marie Erickson
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting access to and copies of any and all records pertaining to Erica Marie Erickson (date of birth: 02/09/1983), potentially identified in your records as "Erica Erickson."

Specifically, I am seeking records related to case number 2023-5-006-02334, which may be associated with the address Carr. 401 Km 2.0 Bo. Playa, Añasco. 

This may include, but is not limited to:
 * Court documents, including indictments, complaints, motions, orders, and judgments.
 * Arrest records and warrants.
 * Investigative reports and supporting documentation.
 * Correspondence and communications related to the case.
 * Any other records pertaining to Erica Erickson in connection with the specified case number.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Elixir Labs Contract for Oregon Provider Management and Payment Platform
communications.communication:
Good morning Toni,

We received an email request via the platform Muckrock for a public records request. The following was the body of the email:

“Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:
Contract awarded to Elixir Labs from the Provider Management Platform RFP, #S-58100-00007532.
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.”

DELC’s public record request form can be found here: Department of Early Learning and Care : Contact Us : About Us : State of Oregon<https://www.oregon.gov/delc/about-us/pages/contact-us.aspx> .
The are also separate instructions for alternate submission forms. DELC’s public records request system allows us to accurately track and communicate regarding requests and the back and forth regarding the request. I look forward to hearing from you or seeing your submission soon.

In accordance with ORS 192.324(4)(a), the public body may establish fees reasonably calculated to reimburse the public body for the public body’s actual cost of making public records available, including costs for summarizing, compiling, or tailoring the public records, either in organization or media, to meet the request.

Please let me know if you have any questions or concerns.

Best wishes,
[A picture containing graphics, cartoon  Description automatically generated]
Madison Buck (She/Her)​
Department of Early Learning and Care​
Public Records and Communication Specialist
DELC.PRRequest@DELC.oregon.gov<mailto:DELC.PRRequest@DELC.oregon.gov>
Website: Oregon.gov/DELC<https://protect-us.mimecast.com/s/4T6sCW6qNgs52KYX8Ix6GqA?domain=oregon.gov>​

The Oregon Department of Early Learning and Care (DELC) fosters coordinated, culturally appropriate, and family-centered services that recognize and respect the strengths of children, families and early learning and care professionals. Our vision is that all children, families, early care and education professionals, and communities are supported and empowered to thrive.

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: VMI Speakers
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records from April 2024 to the date of this request of communications, coordination, contracts, quotes, proposals, purchase orders, agreements or other arrangements for cadets, staff, and faculty training, workshops, presentations, instruction and/or other offerings from any outside person, organization and/or contractor that are or will be applicable for services provided during the 2024 – 2025 academic year. Scope is regardless if the services were provided or not. These records are between any member of the VMI Faculty or staff including, without limitation, the VMI Procurement Office, Superintendent’s Office, Human Resources Office, Inspector General/Title IX office, Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Office and/or any others involved in the identification, selection, coordination, acquisition and delivery of trainings, workshop(s), presentations and/or instruction regardless if they are purchased and/or provided at no cost. This includes and/or any coordination and/or procurements and/or sessions completed or ongoing regardless if agreements were reached or not and/or if training, workshops, presentations, instruction and/or other offerings were provided, not provided or are planned. The scope of this request includes, without limitation any and all speaker bios and proposed or provided presentations, trainings, workshop structures, topics and/or programs of instruction. A the minimum these should include, without limitation, BigSpeak Inc.,Campus Outreach Services Inc.,Kara Dixon Vuic,Raven Solomon Enterprises LLC,Rainbow Bridge,NewPoint Strategies,Modern Military Association,Passageways, Inc.,Visions,Woods Rogers PLC. title: Guerini Crime Family (U.S. Department of State)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Guerini Crime Family (U.S. Department of State)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear FOIA Officer,

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act. I seek access to records in your possession regarding the activities of the Guerini crime family, specifically relating to:

1. Their involvement in dock strikes and union activity during the post-World War II period.
2. Their participation in political violence in post-war France.
3. Their role in heroin trafficking, particularly connections between Europe and the United States during the mid-20th century.

Scope of Request:

Timeframe: 1945–1960.
Geographic Focus: Primarily France and Europe, with connections to the United States.
Focus Areas: Organized crime, labor union influence, political unrest, and narcotics trafficking.

Specific Records of Interest:

-Investigations, surveillance, or intelligence reports related to the Guerini crime family or their associates.
-Records detailing international collaboration or law enforcement efforts targeting organized crime and narcotics trafficking.
-Reports on labor unrest or political violence where organized crime may have played a role.

Purpose of Request:
This request is made for historical research purposes to understand the influence of organized crime on labor movements, political events, and international narcotics trafficking. The information sought is of public and scholarly interest and pertains to understanding transnational organized crime during the post-war era.

Additional Notes:

I am not requesting personal information or records that identify confidential informants, third parties, or victims. My request pertains solely to records documenting the activities of the Guerini family or broader patterns associated with their influence.
If any records contain sensitive material, I request that redacted versions be provided in accordance with FOIA requirements.  Please include any records that originated from predecessor agencies (e.g., the Federal Bureau of Narcotics, Bureau of Narcotics and Dangerous Drugs, etc.).  If any portion of this request is denied, I request a detailed explanation of the exemption(s) applied and a Vaughn Index describing withheld records and justifications for non-disclosure.

File Categories to Search:
Please search any relevant investigative, intelligence, or archival files pertaining to:
1. Narcotics trafficking (e.g., heroin smuggling routes from France to the U.S.).
2. Labor movements and union activity (e.g., dock strikes influenced by organized crime).
3. Political violence or unrest in post-war France tied to organized crime.

Thank you for your assistance. Please feel free to contact me here if clarification or additional information is required to process this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Edward Nestor

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Guerini Crime Family (Central Intelligence Agency)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear FOIA Officer,

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act. I seek access to records in your possession regarding the activities of the Guerini crime family, specifically relating to:

1. Their involvement in dock strikes and union activity during the post-World War II period.
2. Their participation in political violence in post-war France.
3. Their role in heroin trafficking, particularly connections between Europe and the United States during the mid-20th century.

Scope of Request:

Timeframe: 1945–1960.
Geographic Focus: Primarily France and Europe, with connections to the United States.
Focus Areas: Organized crime, labor union influence, political unrest, and narcotics trafficking.

Specific Records of Interest:

-Investigations, surveillance, or intelligence reports related to the Guerini crime family or their associates.
-Records detailing international collaboration or law enforcement efforts targeting organized crime and narcotics trafficking.
-Reports on labor unrest or political violence where organized crime may have played a role.

Purpose of Request:
This request is made for historical research purposes to understand the influence of organized crime on labor movements, political events, and international narcotics trafficking. The information sought is of public and scholarly interest and pertains to understanding transnational organized crime during the post-war era.

Additional Notes:

I am not requesting personal information or records that identify confidential informants, third parties, or victims. My request pertains solely to records documenting the activities of the Guerini family or broader patterns associated with their influence.
If any records contain sensitive material, I request that redacted versions be provided in accordance with FOIA requirements.  Please include any records that originated from predecessor agencies (e.g., the Federal Bureau of Narcotics, Bureau of Narcotics and Dangerous Drugs, etc.).  If any portion of this request is denied, I request a detailed explanation of the exemption(s) applied and a Vaughn Index describing withheld records and justifications for non-disclosure.

File Categories to Search:
Please search any relevant investigative, intelligence, or archival files pertaining to:
1. Narcotics trafficking (e.g., heroin smuggling routes from France to the U.S.).
2. Labor movements and union activity (e.g., dock strikes influenced by organized crime).
3. Political violence or unrest in post-war France tied to organized crime.

Thank you for your assistance. Please feel free to contact me here if clarification or additional information is required to process this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Edward Nestor

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Public records request logs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Logs,  or reports maintained by the Mayor's Office that track public records requests submitted to the City of Boston.

Documentation of the frequency of denials or rejections of public records requests, including reasons for denials where applicable.

Any correspondence or internal reports summarizing compliance with the Massachusetts Public Records Law by the Mayor's Office, including metrics related to timeliness and response rates.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian McCarter

title: NASA support for 2014 Pink Floyd music video "Marooned"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: NASA support for 2014 Pink Floyd music video "Marooned"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to NASA's support for the Pink Floyd music video "Marooned," released in 2014 and directed by Aubrey Powell. NASA's support for the video is apparently confirmed by the inclusion of an entry for "Pink Floyd" in a list 2014 NASA-supported entertainment released to me by FOIA. I request any and all documents pertaining to NASA support for the Pink Floyd music video "Marooned." Such documents may include but should not be not limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of NASA and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Marooned," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Marines support for "NCIS Hawaii"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between the US Marine Corps and the production of the TV series NCIS Hawaii (2021-2024). According to a document released to me by the Marines through FOIA (see attached), the Marines provided support to this production in 2022. I therefore request any and all documents pertaining to Marine Corps support for "NCIS Hawaii," inclusive of all episodes supported by the Marines. Such documents may include but should not be not limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the Marines and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "NCIS Hawaii," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

Sincerely,

communications.subject: FOI Records Request :: R000059-112724
communications.communication:
Dear Toni Thompson: 
 
 
This message is an acknowledgement that the Connecticut Office of Early Childhood received your Freedom of Information Act request on 11/27/2024. It was given the reference number R000059-112724 for tracking purposes. 
 
 
This letter does not constitute a denial of your request. Rather, in accordance with the Freedom of Information Act, we are in the process of researching and gathering documentation which may be responsive to it. Once the documents are gathered, we will then conduct a review to determine if statutory exemptions to disclosure may apply to some or all of the documents. Upon completion of that review, we will be able to provide you with any responsive, non-exempt documents. 
 
Please note the department reserves the right to charge any such other fees as may be appropriate pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the OEC FOI Records Center. 
Connecticut Office of Early Childhood

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R000056-112724
communications.communication:
Dear Toni Thompson: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of New Mexico Early Childhood Education and Care Department. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA) NMSA 1978, § 14-2-1. Your request was received in this office on 11/27/2024 and given the reference number R000056-112724 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: November 27, 2024

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Contract awarded to Resilient 21. The total is approximately $4M and the scope of work includes professional development information system (PDIS) and early childhood information system.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Toni Thompson 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant division(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. 
 
PLEASE NOTE: Pursuant to IPRA NMSA 1978, § 14-2-8(D), you will receive a response to your request as soon as is practicable, but not later than fifteen days after receiving your request. In addition, IPRA does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
New Mexico Early Childhood Education and Care Department 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Records Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXWKPfADcre3-2B-2BxrcgeNv2ptPN8Q1dggg2jZVZcL4kNyIybFHN2fa7ungjA9rcAmUCxpf-2BR4VgN8VhyA4nxWEh2w-3Dj-hj_evc9u1gB4kq5Yfu-2Fub43pYoy-2B-2Bvi9uPaXi9bHllEa60xrBfqqXyoniBSULBBvVTeOF2fowCirbE-2B4aWdzRdUa-2Fh8YVugkoJHtlijsoB9X5Li-2Fq2dlMuag0QBk94SUhNM97Ik07wyTFP4-2FtM05kkz7XLhcBAbAzdvEl5bIKAwNyAPmUWBhvin0Wkeip-2FgRPU4aCJBaEHJSbNC1F0xIY5kzxx2S0xf5eon1IRK8fJWw4E-3D)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Earl Lawrence Durham
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating, to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry of Earl Lawrence Durham (d. October 27, 2007), including files 100-HQ-248516 and 100-CG-12890. Previously released records indicate Durham was the subject of wiretapping and had at least one informant reporting on his activities. The following symbol sources were directed at Durham between 1954 and 1956: CG 5974-S, CG 5985-S, CG 6040-S* (https://archive.org/details/FBI-ELSUR-nsia/18-cv-01868%20pp%202770-3077%20-%20ELSUR%20Indices%20-%20Chicago%20Section%204/page/n299/mode/2up; https://archive.org/details/FBI-ELSUR-nsia/18-cv-01868%20pp%203298-2482%20-%20ELSUR%20Indices%20-%20Chicago%20Section%206/page/n93/mode/2up) Proof of death is not required as his death was widely reported: https://www.legacy.com/us/obituaries/chicagosuntimes/name/earl-durham-obituary?id=29644078 (This is a reprint of an obituary that originally appeared in the Chicago Sun-Times); https://www.ilga.gov/legislation/fulltext.asp?GAID=10&SessionID=76&GA=95&DocTypeID=SR&DocNum=422&LegID=48589&SpecSess=&Session= (Illinois State Senate resolution commemorating Durham)

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Columbia County Public Health (Columbia County Commissioners)
communications.communication:
Dear Lizbeth,

Thank you for your interest in public records of Columbia County. Your request has been received and is being processed. Your request was received in this office on 12/02/2024 and given the reference number W022-120224 for tracking purposes.

Please see our request for clarification in red.

Records requested:

“Katherine roughton’s resignation letter/termination letter.

email communications between commissioners and Katherine Roughton from 03/01/23 - 09/01/23- all communications.

email communications between jasmine helm and Katherine Roughton discussing other employees from dates 06/01/22-09/01/23 –Please supply specific keywords to search for.

Complaints to commissioners by county employee staff concerning Beth Compton from from 01/01/23-to termination

All complaints to commissioners and HR including emails notes memos documents from April 2022-September 2023 concerning Katherine Roughton

Email communications between Katherine Roughton and commissioner Chuck Amerein from 04/01/22-through 01/23”



Columbia County received two identical requests from you; one addressed to the Commissioners and one addressed to the Human Resources department. Would you like us to handle each request separately?

If there are fees associated with providing copies we will request a down payment of 10% of total cost prior to work beginning on reviewing and redacting (if necessary) all responsive documentation.

Please be advised that the County responds to numerous public records requests and due to the large volume of requests ahead of this one, we estimate the time of response to your specific request to be approximately 60 working days from the date of this letter. The response being provided to you is an approximation only, and Columbia County will make every reasonable effort to respond as promptly as possible to your public record request.

RCW 42.56.070(8) prohibits any public agency from giving, selling or providing access to lists of individuals for "commercial purposes".
Regards,

Virginia Schmidt
Clerk of the Board/Office Administrator
Columbia County Commissioners
311 E Main St.
Dayton, WA 99328
(509)-382-4542

Email is considered a public document and may be subject to the Public Records Act.

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Seisint Incorporated
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

DOJ/FBI records from (SEC trading review dated May 15, 2002), related to Seisint Inc. involvement with the investigation.

Page 2 notes DOJ involvement in the investigation:
https://unredacted.com/wp-content/uploads/2010/04/9-11-sec-report.pdf

Page 9 of MFR03010885 dated 9/16/03 states:

"At the conclusion of the investigation, the SEC gave DOJ a CD containing all the
relevant trades the SEC and the SROs had found. Cella then accompanied Paul Johns of
DOJ and FBI agent Gurvais Grigg to Seisint, a DOJ contractor based in Virgina, where
Seisint's computer experts "sliced and diced" the data on its powerful computers to
generate a series of reports. Johns, Grigg, and Cella reviewed these reports, which
revealed no evidence of illicit trading. Cella said the CD contained all of the trading
information obtained through the blue-sheeting process, which is a tremendous amount of
data."

https://cryptome.org/nara/sec/sec-03-0916.pdf

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alan

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Colorado Medicaid provider list
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain an updated electronic list of all Colorado Medicaid healthcare providers with the INCLUSION of their respective National Provider Identifier (NPI) numbers, medicaid ID and state license number (CSV or excel or TXT format are preferred). All types of healthcare practitioners from all dates electronically available (active, inactive and retired licensee data sets would be greatly appreciated. The specific items to be included in data set:

1. Provider first and last name
2. Medicaid Identification number 
3. National Provider Identifier (NPI) number
4. Colorado State License number and initial date of issuance or expiry (if available/applicable)
5. Education / School/Training, if available
6. Provider type (MD, DO, PA, RN, PT, OT, OD, CRNA, DMD, DDS, DPM etc)
7. Provider Specialty
8. Provider Practice Location (Including Practice Name)
9. Please include Data Dictionary describing state Medicaid Data Sets, if available.
10. Status of Active, Inactive, Retired

Thank you for considering my request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenn Kellogg

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: constitutional Sheriff (CSPOA)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting all records, documents, communications or other materials from 2018 to present that contain certain key phrases, such as “constitutional training” and the “Constitutional Sheriffs and Peace Officers Association,” CSPOA, protect America Now as well as records that were sent to, from or included mention of the sheriff group’s leadership, from and too all employed deputies at Columbia county Sheriff’s Office including elected Sheriff Joe Helm. 

I am requesting all receipts and money paid for CPSOA training, dues, membership, travel to events, rallies, from 2018-present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Lizbeth Salander

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Douglas PD Modified DESE Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Act, M. G. L.c.66, §10, for public records in the custody of your police department.

Under the Criminal Justice Reform Act, school districts and law enforcement agencies must “specify the manner and division of responsibility for collecting and reporting the school-based arrests, citations and court referrals of students to the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education” (DESE). DESE began collecting data on school-related arrests in the 2018-19 school year. In the 2019-20 school year, DESE has expanded that collection to include data on all referrals to law enforcement. DESE has defined these terms as follows, borrowing the same definitions used by the U.S. Department of Education since its 2009 Civil Rights Data Collection.

A school-related arrest “[r]efers to an arrest of a student for any activity conducted on school grounds, during off campus school activities (including while taking school transportation), or due to a referral by any school official. All school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”

A referral to law enforcement “[i]s an action by which a student is reported to any law enforcement agency or official, including a school police unit, for an incident that occurs on school grounds, during school-related events, or while taking school transportation, regardless of whether official action is taken. Citations, tickets, court referrals, and school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.”

I request the following public records, as defined in M. G. L.c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth):

1. An extract of your records management system or database that includes each school-related arrest and each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced). I request an extract of the database to be provided as an electronic spreadsheet (.xls, .xlsx, .csv, .tsv, or .ods format). If such format is unavailable, we request the extract of the database to be provided in a searchable, machine-readable form, as per 950 CMR 32.04(5).” Specifically, we request an extract of the database to include the following descriptions of the data in each column. This may be provided as clear, descriptive column headers in the database extract or in a separate document:

a. Date of arrest or referral to law enforcement

b. Time of arrest or referral to law enforcement

c. Charge (or charges)

d. Whether the individual(s) was arrested or referred to law enforcement

e. Sex of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement

f. Age of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement

g. Race of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement

h. Ethnicity of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement

i. Disability status of the individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement

j. Whether the individual arrested or referred to law enforcement is a student at the school.

k. Name of arresting officer, if applicable, and

l. Badge number of the arresting officer or the officer that referred the youth to law enforcement, as applicable.

m. Incident number or other unique identifier for each arrest or referral to law enforcement

n. Offender number or other unique identifier for each individual arrested or referred to law enforcement

2. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each school-related arrest conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced).

3. Please provide an unduplicated count of arrested students for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced).

4. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until

the day the records are produced), per the U.S. Department of Education’s Civil Rights Data Collection for that year. For each referral to law enforcement, please include the school, demographic, and incident information described in DESE’s School Safety and Discipline Report Data Handbook v. 20.0.

5. Please also provide an unduplicated counts of referrals to law enforcement (as defined above) for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022 and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced).

As this request involves a matter of public interest and will not be used for any commercial purpose, we ask that all fees associated with this request be waived pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(k). The purpose of this request is to determine whether your school district and police department are complying with their reporting obligations under the Criminal Justice Reform Act. “The public has an interest in knowing whether public servants are carrying out their duties in an efficient and law-abiding manner.”

It would be ill-advised to impose a fee for data that your police department may have failed to report in violation of statutory and regulatory duty. Moreover, as you know, municipalities with a population of over 20,000 may not assess a fee for the first 2 hours of time spent searching for, compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. Finally, pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(i), a records access officer shall assess no fee greater than the lowest hourly rate of a person capable of compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. In the event that a charge is incurred for this request which you will not waive, please so indicate and include an itemization of estimated good faith costs.

Please provide public records to a requestor in an electronic format unless the record is not available in an electronic format. M. G. L.c 66, § 6A(d).

The Public Records Act requires that you comply with this request within ten (10) business days following receipt. If you believe that documents or data responsive to any request herein is not public record and thus not subject to disclosure, please set forth in writing the specific reasons for such assertion, including the specific exemption or exemptions that you believe apply. To the extent that you determine that records need to be redacted in order to be produced under any law protecting the privacy of named individuals, please do so rather than withholding them in their entirety.

If you have any questions about this request, or need additional time to respond, please contact me. Thank you in advance for your prompt response to this request.

Sincerely,

Katherine Stathulis

J.D. Research Fellow

Center for Public Interest, Advocacy, and Collaboration k.stathulis@northeastern.edu

617-373-5862

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rylee Meints
